meanings.definition: Not having a permanent position or status, especially in academia.
meanings.sent1: The new teacher was feeling uncertain about her untenured role at the university.
meanings.sent2: Many professors start as untenured faculty members before earning tenure.
meanings.sent3: The untenured professor accidentally walked into the wrong classroom on her first day.
meanings.sent4: Her untenured status made her feel like a temporary puzzle piece in the academic world.
meanings.sent5: The untenured position required constant effort to prove her worth.

meanings.definition: Without the guarantee of continued employment or tenure.
meanings.sent1: The company offered him an untenured contract with no promise of long-term job security.
meanings.sent2: She was worried about her untenured position and the possibility of being let go.
meanings.sent3: The untenured employee joked that every day felt like a job interview.
meanings.sent4: His untenured status felt like walking on a tightrope without a safety net.
meanings.sent5: The uncertainty of his untenured role kept him on edge at work.
